snippet: The State Supreme Court vacated most capital sentences imposed since a 2002 ruling by the United States Supreme Court, sending them back to trial courts for resentencing....
abstract: Florida State Supreme Court vacates over 100 death sentences imposed since 2002 United States Supreme Court ruling that said jury, rather than judge, must decide whether execution is warranted; convictions are not overturned and prosecutors may still seek death penalty at resentencing; ruling could place huge burden on courts.
lead_paragraph: The State Supreme Court vacated most capital sentences imposed since a 2002 ruling by the United States Supreme Court, sending them back to trial courts for resentencing.

headline.main: Florida Ruling Upends More Than 100 Death Sentences
headline.print_headline: Sentences of Death Revisited in Florida
